intro: Timonius palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan timonius, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palm-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
